document.title: 21st Century Dance Content Standards and Objectives for West Virginia Schools

3BCF3790DFE80131DD3668A86D17958E.description: create an interdisciplinary project using media technologies that present dance in a new or enhanced form.

3BCEE5A0DFE80131DD3568A86D17958E.description: compare and contrast one choreographic work to one other artwork from the same culture and time period in terms of how those works reflect the artistic/cultural/historical context of that same period.

3BCE9C10DFE80131DD3468A86D17958E.description: Students will connect dance to other disciplines.

3BCDFFF0DFE80131DD3268A86D17958E.description: summarize their own creative process used in choreographing a dance phrase.

3BCDB8D0DFE80131DD3168A86D17958E.description: create and perform, in small groups, a dance with coherence and aesthetic unity.

3BCD7160DFE80131DD3068A86D17958E.description: Students will understand and apply choreographic principles, processes and structures.

3BCCDF60DFE80131DD2E68A86D17958E.description: analyze issues of ethnicity, gender, social/economic class, age and/or physical condition in relation to dance and determine how these issues affect the art.

3BCC8670DFE80131DD2D68A86D17958E.description: analyze the style of a choreographer or cultural form and create a dance in that style.

3BCC3840DFE80131DD2C68A86D17958E.description: transfer how skills developed in dance to enhance present and future personal goals.

3BCBEB40DFE80131DD2B68A86D17958E.description: Students will employ critical and creative thinking skills in dance

3BCB3260DFE80131DD2968A86D17958E.description: perform dances illustrating different historical/cultural/political contexts.

3BCADC90DFE80131DD2868A86D17958E.description: research and create a time line illustrating important dance events placing them in their cultural/historical/political contexts.

3BCA7700DFE80131DD2768A86D17958E.description: perform techniques of various dance forms.

3BCA1940DFE80131DD2668A86D17958E.description: Students will examine and demonstrate dance from various cultures and historical periods

3BC96EB0DFE80131DD2468A86D17958E.description: research and analyze the challenges facing professional performer's in maintaining a healthy lifestyle.

3BC91F50DFE80131DD2368A86D17958E.description: devise a plan to assist in preparation for a career in dance.

3BC8D0D0DFE80131DD2268A86D17958E.description: Students will relate dance to physical health.

3BC82C70DFE80131DD2068A86D17958E.description: refine technique/skills through self-evaluation and correction

3BC7E410DFE80131DD1F68A86D17958E.description: perform dance skills, demonstrating reliability, consistency, clarity and stylistic nuance.

3BC799D0DFE80131DD1E68A86D17958E.description: Students will develop and practice movement elements in performing dance.

3BC70240DFE80131DD1C68A86D17958E.description: create and perform (for a public audience) an individual dance conveying a personal experience, belief or theme.

3BC6AD60DFE80131DD1B68A86D17958E.description: Students will use dance as a way to create and communicate meaning.

3BC5C950DFE80131DD1868A86D17958E.description: research an interdisciplinary project using media technologies that present dance in a new or enhanced form.

3BC57500DFE80131DD1768A86D17958E.description: research one choreographic work and one other artwork from the same culture and time period and examine how those works reflect the artistic/cultural/historical context of the time period.

3BC51A50DFE80131DD1668A86D17958E.description: Students will connect dance to other disciplines.

3BC46FB0DFE80131DD1468A86D17958E.description: research and analyze the creative process of choreographers (e.g., video biographies, interviews).

3BC420C0DFE80131DD1368A86D17958E.description: apply choreographic principles in creating a small group dance with coherence and aesthetic unity.

3BC3B440DFE80131DD1268A86D17958E.description: Students will understand and apply choreographic principles, processes and structures.

3BC2F8D0DFE80131DD1068A86D17958E.description: research and discuss issues of ethnicity, gender, social/economic class, age and/or physical condition in relation to dance.

3BC2B190DFE80131DD0F68A86D17958E.description: research and analyze the styles of several choreographers or dance companies.

3BC267B0DFE80131DD0E68A86D17958E.description: discuss and research how skills developed in dance are applicable to a variety of careers (e.g., sports, modeling, secretary, therapist).

3BC22170DFE80131DD0D68A86D17958E.description: Students will employ critical and creative thinking skills in dance

3BC19120DFE80131DD0B68A86D17958E.description: perform a dance that displays the traditions and techniques of a specific culture or historical period.

3BC138A0DFE80131DD0A68A86D17958E.description: examine and discuss the traditions and techniques of creative and concert forms of dance

3BC0F090DFE80131DD0968A86D17958E.description: compare and contrast the role and significance of dance in two different historical/cultural/political contexts.

3BC0A120DFE80131DD0868A86D17958E.description: Students will examine and demonstrate dance from various cultures and historical periods.

3BBFF110DFE80131DD0668A86D17958E.description: analyze historical and cultural images of the body in dance and compare these to the images of the body in contemporary media.

3BBF98D0DFE80131DD0568A86D17958E.description: research and discuss the challenges facing performers in maintaining healthy lifestyles.

3BBF4C10DFE80131DD0468A86D17958E.description: devise a plan to incorporate their personal health goals throughout life.

3BBF0070DFE80131DD0368A86D17958E.description: Students will relate dance to physical health.

3BBD98A0DFE80131DCFF68A86D17958E.description: perform, consistently, rhythm and timing during a movement phrase or dance.

3BBD0910DFE80131DCFD68A86D17958E.description: Students will develop and practice movement elements in performing dance.

3BBC7820DFE80131DCFB68A86D17958E.description: create and perform (in class) an individual dance conveying a personal experience, belief or theme.

3BBC2940DFE80131DCFA68A86D17958E.description: research and incorporate other viewpoints when creating dance to convey meaning.

3BBBCB30DFE80131DCF968A86D17958E.description: Students will use dance as a way to create and communicate meaning.

3BBAA140DFE80131DCF668A86D17958E.description: demonstrate how technology can be used to reinforce, enhance or alter the dance idea in an interdisciplinary project.

3BBA52D0DFE80131DCF568A86D17958E.description: create an interdisciplinary project based on a theme identified by the student, including dance and two other disciplines.

3BB9FF30DFE80131DCF468A86D17958E.description: Students will connect dance to other disciplines.

3BB971F0DFE80131DCF268A86D17958E.description: employ improvisation to generate movement for choreography.

3BB927E0DFE80131DCF168A86D17958E.description: create and perform a dance phrase using at least two choreographic forms.

3BB8DAB0DFE80131DCF068A86D17958E.description: create and perform a dance phrase containing three to five elements of choreography.

3BB88650DFE80131DCEF68A86D17958E.description: Students will understand and apply choreographic principles, processes and structures.

3BB7D6C0DFE80131DCED68A86D17958E.description: formulate and answer aesthetic questions based on a performance

3BB791F0DFE80131DCEC68A86D17958E.description: apply aesthetic criteria to evaluate the student's own work and the work of others in a positive and constructive manner.

3BB74C00DFE80131DCEB68A86D17958E.description: create a dance and revise it over time, explaining the revisions and their impact on the final product.

3BB705E0DFE80131DCEA68A86D17958E.description: Students will employ critical and creative thinking skills in dance

3BB67040DFE80131DCE868A86D17958E.description: research and analyze how dance and dancers are perceived in contemporary media when compared to other time periods and cultures.

3BB617E0DFE80131DCE768A86D17958E.description: answer questions about dance and dancers within the twentieth century.

3BB5CF20DFE80131DCE668A86D17958E.description: examine and discuss the traditions and techniques of recreational and aerobic forms of dance.

3BB586C0DFE80131DCE568A86D17958E.description: perform and differentiate between two or more culturally diverse dances.

3BB53600DFE80131DCE468A86D17958E.description: Students will examine and demonstrate dance from various cultures and historical periods

3BB49450DFE80131DCE268A86D17958E.description: research historical and cultural images of the body as it relates to dance.

3BB435A0DFE80131DCE168A86D17958E.description: describe how specific lifestyle choices affect the dancer.

3BB3E8B0DFE80131DCE068A86D17958E.description: assess personal physical health goals in order to revise and refine.

3BB39460DFE80131DCDF68A86D17958E.description: Students will relate dance to physical health.

3BB2DB70DFE80131DCDD68A86D17958E.description: demonstrate the ability to remember extended movement sequences.

3BB26100DFE80131DCDC68A86D17958E.description: articulate the importance of projection while performing dance skills.

3BB20930DFE80131DCDB68A86D17958E.description: modify the dance concepts to reconstruct a dance phrase.

3BB1BE60DFE80131DCDA68A86D17958E.description: demonstrate rhythm and timing during movement.

3BB17490DFE80131DCD968A86D17958E.description: identify and demonstrate longer and more complex steps and patterns from several dance styles/traditions.

3BB0D8D0DFE80131DCD768A86D17958E.description: Students will develop and practice movement elements in performing dance.

3BB03FF0DFE80131DCD568A86D17958E.description: collaborate to create a dance that communicates a relevant social theme.

3BAFF7F0DFE80131DCD468A86D17958E.description: use improvisation to prepare a movement phrase that communicates abstract ideas.

3BAFB000DFE80131DCD368A86D17958E.description: articulate understanding of how personal experience influences the interpretation of a dance

3BAF65C0DFE80131DCD268A86D17958E.description: Students will use dance as a way to create and communicate meaning.

3BAE5B80DFE80131DCCF68A86D17958E.description: identify and discuss commonalities and differences between dance and other disciplines with regard to fundamental concepts such as materials, elements and ways of communicating meaning.

3BADF6E0DFE80131DCCE68A86D17958E.description: discuss how technology can be used to reinforce, enhance or alter the dance idea.

3BADA9B0DFE80131DCCD68A86D17958E.description: create a group interdisciplinary project based on a theme identified by the group.

3BAD58C0DFE80131DCCC68A86D17958E.description: Students will connect dance to other disciplines.

3BACA5A0DFE80131DCCA68A86D17958E.description: examine improvisation as a method for generating movement for choreography.

3BAC56A0DFE80131DCC968A86D17958E.description: identify, define and practice choreographic forms through the creation of a movement phrase.

3BAC0C60DFE80131DCC868A86D17958E.description: identify, define and practice elements of choreography.

3BABBB70DFE80131DCC768A86D17958E.description: Students will understand and apply choreographic principles, processes and structures.

3BAB0BA0DFE80131DCC568A86D17958E.description: answer aesthetic questions in a group setting.

3BAABEA0DFE80131DCC468A86D17958E.description: establish a set of aesthetic criteria and apply it in evaluating student work.

3BAA71A0DFE80131DCC368A86D17958E.description: create a series of dance phrases and revise them over time.

3BAA0E80DFE80131DCC268A86D17958E.description: Students will employ critical and creative thinking skills in dance.

3BA96530DFE80131DCC068A86D17958E.description: discuss dance and dancers as perceived in contemporary media when compared to other time periods and cultures.

3BA90770DFE80131DCBF68A86D17958E.description: research and answer questions about dance and dancers prior to the twentieth century.

3BA8AAD0DFE80131DCBE68A86D17958E.description: identify the four dance forms and give examples of each

3BA85FD0DFE80131DCBD68A86D17958E.description: perform and report on the history of culturally diverse dances.

3BA809F0DFE80131DCBC68A86D17958E.description: Students will examine and demonstrate dance from various cultures and historical periods.

3BA772E0DFE80131DCBA68A86D17958E.description: identify lifestyle choices and their affect on the dancer.

3BA71AE0DFE80131DCB968A86D17958E.description: examine personal physical health and identify strengths and weaknesses to formulate goals.

3BA6CB60DFE80131DCB868A86D17958E.description: understand and apply health related concepts to dance.

3BA67FF0DFE80131DCB768A86D17958E.description: Students will relate dance to physical health.

3BA57210DFE80131DCB468A86D17958E.description: recognize and demonstrate the various dance concepts.

3BA50590DFE80131DCB368A86D17958E.description: understand rhythm and timing as it relates to movement.

3BA4B670DFE80131DCB268A86D17958E.description: identify and practice steps and patterns from several different dance styles/traditions.

3BA45680DFE80131DCB168A86D17958E.description: identify and practice locomotor and nonlocomotor/axial movements with an awareness of alignment.

3BA401F0DFE80131DCB068A86D17958E.description: Students will develop and practice movement elements in performing dance.

3BA36040DFE80131DCAE68A86D17958E.description: improvise a movement phrase that communicates a relevant social theme.

3BA2F400DFE80131DCAD68A86D17958E.description: identify and conclude the distinguishing moment when movement becomes dance (when movement takes on purpose and intent it becomes dance).

3BA291F0DFE80131DCAC68A86D17958E.description: recognize and communicate abstract ideas through movement.

3BA24060DFE80131DCAB68A86D17958E.description: observe and explain how personal experience can influence the individual interpretation of a movement.

3BA1F570DFE80131DCAA68A86D17958E.description: Students will use dance as a way to create and communicate meaning.
